content:
Degree charts - Bachelor Information Engineering - TUM - TUM School of Computation, Information and Technology

Curriculum for the Bachelor in Information Engineering
Curriculum for the Bachelor in Information Engineering
Based on the degree chart, you can see how the six semesters of the bachelor’s program are distributed. For swift and successful progress through the program, we recommend that you schedule the modules at the specified time and in the order indicated. For information on the course offerings, please click directly on the modules in the table.
Curriculum for the Bachelor in Information Engineering
----------------------------------------



----------------------------------------

Degree chart
Curriculum for the Bachelor in Information Engineering > Degree chart
Table (Curriculum for the Bachelor in Information Engineering > Degree chart):
Semester | ECTS | Informatics | Mathematics | Management | Extradisciplinary fundamentals
1 | 30 | Introduction to Informatics (INHN0001) *) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=2917377&pOrgNr=14189) | Fundamentals of Programming (INHN0002) *) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=2917382&pOrgNr=14189) | Introduction to Computer Organization and Technology (INHN0003) *) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=2917398&pOrgNr=14189) | Discrete Structures (INHN0004) *) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=2917471&pOrgNr=14189) |   | Support Elective (https://www.cit.tum.de/en/cit/studies/degree-programs/bachelor-information-engineering/elective-modules/#c2556)
2 | 29 | Introduction to Software Engineering (INHN0006) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038558&pOrgNr=14189) | Operating Systems and System Software (INHN0007) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038527&pOrgNr=14189) | Fundamentals of Algorithms and Data Structures (INHN0008) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038693&pOrgNr=14189) | Computational Mathematics I: Linear Algebra (INHN0009) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038227&pOrgNr=14189) |   | Support Elective (https://www.cit.tum.de/en/cit/studies/degree-programs/bachelor-information-engineering/elective-modules/#c2556)
3 | 31 | Fundamentals of Databases (INHN0011) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038689&pOrgNr=14189) | Computer Networking and IT Security (INHN0012) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038805&pOrgNr=14189) | Information Theory and Theory of Computation (INHN0013) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038216&pOrgNr=14189) | Computational Mathematics II: Calculus (INHN0014) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038212&pOrgNr=14189) |   |  
4 | 31 | Enterprise Architecture Management and Reference Models (INHN0017) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038797&pOrgNr=14189) | Introduction to Signal Processing (INHN0016) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038572&pOrgNr=14189) | Business Process Management (INHN0019) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038809&pOrgNr=14189) | Embedded Systems, Cyber-Physical Systems, and Robotics (INHN0018 (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038801&pOrgNr=14189) | Discrete Probability Theory (INHN0020) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038190&pOrgNr=14189) |   |  
Business Process Management (INHN0019) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038809&pOrgNr=14189)
5 | 30 | Bachelor Practical Course (INHN0021) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038813&pOrgNr=14189) | Electives in Informatics (https://www.cit.tum.de/en/cit/studies/degree-programs/bachelor-information-engineering/elective-modules/#c2557) |   |   | Electives in Management (https://www.cit.tum.de/en/cit/studies/degree-programs/bachelor-information-engineering/elective-modules/#c2559) | Support Electives (https://www.cit.tum.de/en/cit/studies/degree-programs/bachelor-information-engineering/elective-modules/#c2556)
6 | 29 | Bachelor's Thesis (INHN0024) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3044822&pOrgNr=14189) | Bachelor's Colloquium (INHN0025) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3044763&pOrgNr=14189) | Electives in Informatics (https://www.cit.tum.de/en/cit/studies/degree-programs/bachelor-information-engineering/elective-modules/#c2557) |   | Electives in Management (https://www.cit.tum.de/en/cit/studies/degree-programs/bachelor-information-engineering/elective-modules/#c2559) | Support Electives (https://www.cit.tum.de/en/cit/studies/degree-programs/bachelor-information-engineering/elective-modules/#c2556)
Please note: This is an ideal version of a curriculum, your acutal / individual course of studies might turn out to be different.

Fundamentals of Databases (INHN0011)6 Credits
Seminar (INHN0015)5 Credits
Introduction to Signal Processing (INHN0016)6 Credits
Table (Curriculum for the Bachelor in Information Engineering > Degree chart):
Business Process Management (INHN0019) (https://campus.tum.de/tumonline/pl/ui/$ctx/WBMODHB.wbShowMHBReadOnly?pKnotenNr=3038809&pOrgNr=14189)

12 Credits
Degree chart
----------------------------------------

*) At the end of the first semester, at least two of the four introductory modules of the first semester indicated by * must be successfully completed. A repeat exam is held at the end of the winter semester/start of the summer semester. There is no resit option in the summer semester because these courses are only offered in the winter semester.

----------------------------------------
